Join us as we welcome New York Times bestselling author Carol Anderson and Emmy-winning journalist Monica Pearson.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Don’t forget to RSVP to the 2019 Annual Membership Meeting and Reception on Thursday, May 9 at 6 p.m. at The Temple in Atlanta.

We will be joined by New York Times bestselling author and Emory Professor Carol Anderson, winner of the National Book Critics Circle Award. A book sale and signing of her books "White Rage" and "One Person, No Vote" will take place at the event. Anderson will be joined by Emmy-winning journalist, former news anchor and current host of Seat at the Table, Monica Pearson.

2019 Annual Membership Meeting

Thursday, May 9, 6 p.m.
The Temple
Schwartz Goldstein Hall
1589 Peachtree St. NW
Atlanta, GA 30309

RSVP TODAY

Thanks to your support, the ACLU has become a force in Georgia! Thousands of concerned Georgians have turned to the ACLU of Georgia as the trusted, ethical, nonpartisan defender of our civil liberties and we have responded to their concerns. In our fight for voter rights, we have protected over 200,000 votes, saved all polling places in Randolph County, and delivered a voter education and Get Out The Vote campaign that drew support from over 83,000 Georgians. We will highlight these 2018 successes and present our 2019 strategy.

The reception is at 6 p.m. and the meeting begins at 7 p.m. in the Schwartz Goldstein Hall of The Temple. Heavy hors d’oeuvres, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages will be provided. Parking is available, but Lyft is encouraged. Use Lyft code ACLUGA19 for a $5 credit. Admission is free.

In 2019, ACLU of Georgia members have an opportunity to elect board members. Vote for new and current board members. Membership numbers are required to vote. Due to a technical glitch we are unable to provide your membership number in this email, but please know we are working hard to resolve the issue. Contact us at philanthropy@acluga.org to request your membership number. We apologize for any inconvenience.

We look forward to seeing you there.

ACLU of Georgia
